data.title: tplimpl: Add support for interfaces to intersect
data.body: Fixes #1952

data.title: docs: Add sanjay-saxena.github.io to the showcase
data.body: Add sanjay-saxena.github.io to the showcase.

data.title: Ignore non-source files on partial rebuild.
data.body:
Partial rebuild does not have the same logic as normal rebuild on
selecting which file to build. This change makes it possible to
share the file select logic between two kinds of build.

Fix #3325.

data.title: Partial rebuild processes files that should be ignored
data.body:
In hugo v0.20, when doing partial rebuild, e.g. `hugo -w`, file list containing changed files does not honor the behavior of full rebuild. Files matching `ignoreFiles` config setting or directories will be proceed by hugo.

```
$ cat config.yaml
baseurl: "http://127.0.0.1:1313"                                                                                                                                                   languagecode: en-us
title: a test title
                                                                                                                                                                                   theme: test

MetaDataFormat: yaml
ignoreFiles: [ "\\.foo$" ]

$ ls -l content
total 0

$ hugo_0.20_linux_amd64 -w
WARNING: Site config's rssURI is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Set baseName in outputFormats.RSS.
Started building sites ...
Built site for language en:
0 draft content
0 future content
0 expired content
0 regular pages created
6 other pages created
0 non-page files copied
0 paginator pages created
0 tags created
0 categories created
total in 1 ms
Watching for changes in /home/anb/tmp/hugo/content
Press Ctrl+C to stop
```
Create some files that shouldn't be pickup by hugo:
```
$ touch content/bar.foo
$ mkdir content/baz
$ ls public
bar.foo  baz  categories/  index.html  index.xml  sitemap.xml  tags/
```

data.title: Add txtpen support in Hugo
data.body:
txtpen provides highlights and in-text commenting similar to Medium for regular Hugo blogs. I have submitted a pull request to enable this feature natively.

https://github.com/spf13/hugo/pull/3320

data.title: Added txtpen support and docs
Add arm64 .deb and binary builds
data.body:
Two target systems, really: a Raspberry Pi 3 running a Debian 8 based HypriotOS, and a Cavium ThunderX 96-core system from Packet (Type 2A) running Ubuntu 16.04 or CoreOS or CentOS 7.

#1772 is the only issue I can see that came up and was resolved, so this should be a small matter of changing "make build" to add one more target.

data.title: Live-reload issue with _index.md vs the others
data.body:
So, 

* if you add a `_index.md` for home page
* Then do a edit on a page that is on the home page
* The home page isn't re-rendered.
* If you delete the  `_index.md`, the live-reload works as expected.

data.title: docs: add non-go dependencies to documentation
data.body: I just recognized i need to have docutils installed in order to run the tests. Maybe this should be noted somewhere in the documentation.

data.title: Allow dates to be parsed from filenames
data.body:
This has been partially discussed in #285.

This allows the date variable to be parsed from a filename with the aim to ease content migration.  Date can be 'datestamped' in any part of a filename, with the example being `2017-01-31-mypost.md`.

Filename fallback is enabled via the `useFilenameDateAsFallback` config value and can find custom date formats using `filenameDateFallbackPattern` (config) and parsed into the `date` param using `filenameDateFallbackFormat` (config).

data.title: WIP: hugolib: Enable nested sections
data.body: Fixes #465

data.title: tpl: "int" func should handle template.HTML input
data.body:
Constructing a string from a string array fails:
```
$array := "1,3"
$values = split $array ","
$str := delimit (last 1 $values)
$int := int $str
```

It however can be done using `printf` which indicates that the above may be a bug:
```
$array := "1,3"
$values = split $array ","
$str := delimit (last 1 $values)
$int := int (sprintf "%s" $str)
```

data.title: Add `float` function to parse string to floating point value
data.body:
Please add a `float` function so that we can convert a string into a floating point number, analogous to the `int` function for integers.

This will allow us to pass named floating point arguments from a shortcode.  

For my use-case, this is to pass a non-integer "aspect ratio" value.  My current workaround is to supply this as a rational two-integer tuple and to perform the division in the template, but is only an approximation when the value is irrational.

data.title: Inaccessible task list markup
data.body:
Hi! Great product. Just thought you ought to know the rendered markup for task lists (https://gohugo.io/content/markdown-extras) is inaccessible i.e. the checkboxes are not correctly labeled. ```
  • a task list item
  • list syntax required
  • incomplete
  • completed
``` You can fix this by wrapping the input and text in a `

data.title: Add "dotted" map access as second try in the index func
data.body:
My proposal to fix the index func in the Go std lib was rejected, so we are stuck with maintaining a patched version.

I'm working on some Hugo docs, and have a shortcode that creates HTML tables from a JSON data file:

```
{{< datatable "media" "types" "Type" "Suffix" >}}
```

I could probably have done the splitting in the template, but right now I have accepted that I have two levels, and my data list is available at `.Site.Data.media.types`.  This logic would break if it suddenly was `.Site.Data.hugo.media.types`.

It would be nice if I could do:

```
{{ $mylist := index .Site.Data "media.types" }}
```

I.e. if the index func 

1. First did a map lookup with "media.types"
2. If none found and the string contains a ".", split it and do a nested lookup

/cc @moorereason

data.title: Add indicator to paginator-generated pages
data.body: Previously mentioned on <https://discuss.gohugo.io/t/detecting-whether-the-current-page-is-blog-page-n/6047/>. In short, it'd be nice if paginator-generated pages could be distinguished somehow from other types of pages without generating another paginator.

data.title: AsciiDoc header metadata
data.body:
AsciiDoc has it's own kind of metadata format, as described here:

http://www.methods.co.nz/asciidoc/userguide.html#X95

It would be pretty cool if gohugo would support the "native" metadata format of AsciiDoc as an alternative to the YAML/TOML/JSON options currently in use.  This would make the content "pure AsciiDoc".

data.title: Publish to remote destination
data.body: Since I'm publishing to S3, I think it would be much easier if the `--destination` flag supported a remote location, rather than having to manually upload every time. I hope this will be considered as a future enhancement. Thanks!

data.title: Add NewTab property to Hugo menus
data.body:
This PR adds support for opening Hugo menu items in a new tab/window.

I've seen old Issues and Discourse posts on new tab support in Hugo but they all references opening links in content/Markdown. Hugo now has a config option to tell BlackFriday to do that and it works great. This PR is specifically for Hugo menus and allowing links to open in a new tab.

Many power users who surf the web know how to middle click a link to open in a new tab or to use the content menu or even control click. Not all users are power users. I've come across many website owners who don't want to lose visitors to certain external links, thus this feature comes in handy.

Also included is a small docs tweak to also mention this new menu item property.

I tried to follow [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/spf13/hugo/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) to the tee here though I'm not sure what would be the best way to modify the tests file to include this property.

data.title: Consider allowing mixed text/html templates
data.body:
I lifted this question before, without too much response. 

I was reminded by this discussion 

https://discuss.gohugo.io/t/hugo-inline-css-optimization-for-google-pagespeed/6032

That the current implementation for custom output types is maybe overly restrictive without any real point.

**Right now it is not possible for a HTML template to include a partial that is plain text (defined to be parsed with `text/template`, i.e. `/layouts/index.html => /layouts/partials/mycss.css` will not work. Note that `/layouts/index.html => /layouts/partials/mycss.html` is perfectly fine.**

I assume that just allowing the above would be useful, and probably work just fine ... Not sure.

Would love to get feedback (any gotchas? security?) before I spend the work on changing this.

/cc @digitalcraftsman @moorereason

data.title: RSS XML can contain invalid characters
data.body:
I found that RSS feeds that Hugo generates can contain characters that are invalid for XML.

The XML 1.0 spec defines valid characters: https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#charsets

One I encountered in the wild in a blog using Hugo is U+000b (\v, vertical tab). (It was this blog, if you're interested: https://blog.hypriot.com/)

Trying to parse such XML raises an error with Go's decoder (which is how I noticed this in the first place):

`XML syntax error on line 10: illegal character code U+000B`

My environment:
  * Hugo Static Site Generator v0.20-DEV linux/amd64 BuildDate: 2017-04-02T17:42:16-07:00
  * Debian Linux (testing) 64bit

Here are two small sample Go programs to help demonstrate the problem:

Create a post with an invalid character:

```
package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
	post := `+++
date = "2017-04-02T16:11:58+05:30"
draft = false
title = "New post"

+++

Hi there
`

	post += "\u000bsudo apt-get update\u000b"

	fmt.Println(post)
}
```

Use like this: `$ ./create-problem-post  > ~/t/bookshelf/content/post/newpost.md`

Then re-generate the site: `$ hugo`

Then try to decode the RSS feed with this program:

```
package main

import (
	"encoding/xml"
	"io/ioutil"
	"log"
	"os"
)

func main() {
	buf, err := ioutil.ReadAll(os.Stdin)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Reading from stdin: %s", err)
	}

	type TestStruct struct {
		Blah string
	}

	t := TestStruct{}

	if err := xml.Unmarshal(buf, &t); err != nil {
		log.Fatalf("Unmarshal XML: %s", err)
	}
}
```

Like so:

```
$ cat ~/t/bookshelf/public/index.xml | ./read-problem-post 
2017/04/02 21:27:43 Unmarshal XML: XML syntax error on line 22: illegal character code U+000B
```

Thank you!

data.title: tplimpl: Return false in "in" func when looking for nil
data.body:
When looking for nil in set of string, the in function should return false.
E.g.: in({[]string{"a", "b", "c"}, nil) will return false

Fixes #3225

data.title: Hugo server doesn't watch the theme's i18n directory if the base i18n directory doesn't exist
data.body:
I have a Hugo site with the following basic structure:

```
.
 archetypes
 content
 layouts
 static
 themes
     mytheme
         archetypes
         i18n
         layouts
         static
```

When using Hugo's server with this configuration, Hugo doesn't watch the theme's i18n directory. Editing `themes/mytheme/i18n/en.yaml` doesn't trigger a reload in the browser, but editing a layout template such as `themes/mytheme/layouts/index.html` triggers a reload, complete with the updated translations.

In this configuration, `hugo server -t mytheme --verbose` gives the following warnings in the output:

```
WARN 2017/04/02 13:26:40 Skip i18nDir: lstat /path/to/mysite/i18n: no such file or directory
Watching for changes in /path/to/mysite/{data,content,layouts,static,themes}
WARN 2017/04/02 13:26:40 Skip i18nDir: lstat /path/to/mysite/i18n: no such file or directory
```

This can be fixed by adding an `i18n` directory in the base site directory, producing a tree like this:

```
.
 archetypes
 content
 i18n
 layouts
 static
 themes
     mytheme
         archetypes
         i18n
         layouts
         static
```

With this directory structure, changes in `themes/mytheme/i18n/en.yaml` cause the browser to refresh the page.

I think that Hugo should watch the `themes/mytheme/i18n` directory even if the base site doesn't have a `i18n` directory.
